If Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as regard the colors that are cherished in the world as permanent, as eternal, as peaceful, as free from illness, as the self, or as belonging to the self, then their desire for those colors will increase;

It is like a cool pond by the roadside, with water possessing good color, aroma, and taste. If someone were to put poison in it, then in the springtime, travelers afflicted by wind, heat, and thirst would compete to come and drink from it.

World-Honored One!
